names.pinyin: huang qi shao yao gui zhi ku jiu tang
names.english: astragalus, peony, cinnamon and bitter wine decoction
names.commonEnglish: Astragalus, Peony, Cinnamon and Bitter Wine Decoction

actions: Tonifies Qi and Blood, strengthens the Spleen, tonifies Wei Qi, promotes urination and reduces edema.
With Gui Zhi, for Qi and Blood Deficiency and Ying and Wei Deficiency with numbness and painful obstruction of the musculature.
Astringes Yin and adjusts the Ying and Wei.
With Gui Zhi, harmonizes the Ying and Wei.
Releases the Exterior, assists Yang, adjusts the Ying and Wei and releases the muscle layer.

syndromes: Obstruction of the Ying and Wei

symptoms: Yellow sweat after having been caught in the rain or taking a cold shower while sweating
A sensation of insects crawling under the skin
